thread.title: Concert to benefit diabetes research

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Concert to benefit diabetes research
text:
In honor of National Diabetes Awareness Month this November, 12 local bands are donating their time and talent to "Rock the Cure 2." This live concert will take place at 6 p.m. on Friday, Nov. 13, at Water Street Music Hall, 204 North Water St.
Proceeds will benefit the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF).
Among the bands performing are Acoustic Brew, Cherry Bomb, Me and the Boyz, State Line, Knight Patrol and more. The band Springer will serve as host band for the evening and will also close out the show.
Tickets will be available at the door for $10 and all proceeds will go directly towards a research grant for JDRF, which is a leading global organization funding Type 1 diabetes research.
The event is being organized by Laurie Schreiner, who has been supporting diabetes research since her daughter Ashley, now 21, was diagnosed at 20 months old.
To learn more about the event, visit Facebook.com/rockthecure or call 315-524-2011
MZEPPIERI@gannett.com
